item.title: Hilbert Transform
item.description: Firstly, compute the FFT of real signal $x(n)$ $$ X(k) = \mathscr{F}[x(n)]=\sum_{n=0}^{N-1}x(n)e^{-\frac{i2\pi kn}{N}} \tag{1}. $$ Let the FFT of $h(n)$ be $H(k)$ to yield $$ H(k)= \begin{cases} &X(k), &\text{ for } k=0 \\ &2X(k), &\text{ for } k=1, 2, \cdots, \frac{N}{2}-1 \\ &0, &\text{ for } k=\frac{N}{2}, \frac{N}{2}+1,\cdots, N-1 \end{cases} \tag{2}. $$ The hilbert transform $h(n)$ of the real signal $x(n)$ is given by $$ h(n) = \mathscr{I} \{ \mathscr{F}^{-1}[H(k)] \} \tag{3}.
